title: How to Make Coffee Figs

steps.headline: Pour the coffee into a bowl.
Add the figs to the coffee liquid.
Transfer to a saucepan.
steps.description: Cook the figs in the coffee liquid for 10 to 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Drain the coffee liquid off the figs.
steps.description: Reserve the coffee liquid and return to the saucepan. Place the figs on a serving dish.

steps.headline: Simmer the coffee liquid for another 10 minutes.
steps.description: Add the sugar, cloves, and orange rind (peel) to simmer as well.

steps.headline: Strain the cloves and rind out.
steps.description: At this point, add a little rum if wished. Then, pour the liquid over the figs.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Provide small forks to pick out the figs for eating as dessert or a snack. Alternatively, place the figs and a little liquid in separate bowls. Add a dollop of ice cream or whipped cream to complete the dessert.

text: Pour the coffee into a bowl.  Add the figs to the coffee liquid. Leave to sit overnight. Transfer to a saucepan. Cook the figs in the coffee liquid for 10 to 15 minutes. Drain the coffee liquid off the figs. Reserve the coffee liquid and return to the saucepan. Place the figs on a serving dish. Simmer the coffee liquid for another 10 minutes. Add the sugar, cloves, and orange rind (peel) to simmer as well. Strain the cloves and rind out. At this point, add a little rum if wished. Then, pour the liquid over the figs. Serve. Provide small forks to pick out the figs for eating as dessert or a snack. Alternatively, place the figs and a little liquid in separate bowls. Add a dollop of ice cream or whipped cream to complete the dessert.
